<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.96

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns Field of View of the given object in [[rad]]ians. Static objects return default value, which is 1. FOV of [[objNull]] is 0. Object FOV is indirectly connected with optics magnification or player view zoom, the narrower the angle the greater the zoom.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> The FOV returned by this command doesn't change if user has custom FOV set in profile. Use it in combination with [[getResolution]] to adjust for the difference if required.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[getObjectFOV]] object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - for units it queries unit weapon optics/zoom, for vehicles - vehicle optics/zoom

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - FOV in [[rad]]ians

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_objFOV = [[getObjectFOV]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_objFOVinDegrees = [[deg]] [[getObjectFOV]] [[cursorObject]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_objType = [[getObjectFOV]] [[vehicle]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> Perceived distance to an object:<code>_vdist = ([[player]] [[distance]] _obj) * ([[getObjectFOV]] [[player]] / 0.75);</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getObjectType]], [[getResolution]]
</value></part></template>
